question.title: Richest Customer Wealth
question.content:
You are given an m x n integer grid accounts where accounts[i][j] is the amount of money the i​​​​​​​​​​​th​​​​ customer has in the j​​​​​​​​​​​th​​​​ bank. Return the wealth that the richest customer has.

A customer's wealth is the amount of money they have in all their bank accounts. The richest customer is the customer that has the maximum wealth.

 

Example 1:

Input: accounts = [[1,2,3],[3,2,1]]
Output: 6
Explanation:
1st customer has wealth = 1 + 2 + 3 = 6
2nd customer has wealth = 3 + 2 + 1 = 6
Both customers are considered the richest with a wealth of 6 each, so return 6.

Example 2:

Input: accounts = [[1,5],[7,3],[3,5]]
Output: 10
Explanation: 
1st customer has wealth = 6
2nd customer has wealth = 10 
3rd customer has wealth = 8
The 2nd customer is the richest with a wealth of 10.

Example 3:

Input: accounts = [[2,8,7],[7,1,3],[1,9,5]]
Output: 17

 

Constraints:

  • m == accounts.length
  • n == accounts[i].length
  • 1 <= m, n <= 50
  • 1 <= accounts[i][j] <= 100
hints: Calculate the wealth of each customer
Find the maximum element in array.

rephrased.body: Given a 2D integer array `accounts` where `accounts[i][j]` represents the amount of money the i-th customer has in the j-th bank, determine the wealth of the richest customer. The wealth of a customer is the sum of the money they have in all their bank accounts. Return the maximum wealth among all customers.

testcases.explanation: The first customer has a wealth of 1 + 2 + 3 = 6. The second customer has a wealth of 3 + 2 + 1 = 6.  The maximum wealth is 6.
The first customer has a wealth of 1 + 5 = 6. The second customer has a wealth of 7 + 3 = 10. The third customer has a wealth of 3 + 5 = 8. The maximum wealth is 10.
The first customer has a wealth of 2 + 8 + 7 = 17. The second customer has a wealth of 7 + 1 + 3 = 11. The third customer has a wealth of 1 + 9 + 5 = 15. The maximum wealth is 17.

Find the maximum element in array.
